block.p: LEAD: Mel Bridgman, the captain of the Devils, has a fracture in his left foot rather than a bruise, which was the original diagnosis. Bridgman was injured Monday night during the victory over the Hartford Whalers, but he finished the game. He missed Wednesday night's victory in Chicago. . . . In a plea-bargaining agreement, Michael Dokes, a former World Boxing Association champion, pleaded guilty in Las Vegas, Nev., to possession of a controlled substance, cocaine.

Dokes, who was arrested last Oct. 6, will be sentenced Feb. 26 and faces a maximum of six years in prison and a $5,000 fine.
